byline.contributor: Ben Rothenberg contributed reporting from North Charleston, S.C. Kitty Bennett and Sarah Cohen contributed research.
byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Police Officer Michael T Slager in North Charleston, SC, is charged with murder after video reveals that he shot and killed Walter L Scott, unarmed black man, as he tried to run away; Slager said initially that he feared for his life after Scott had taken his stun gun, but video shows Slager shooting Scott eight times in the back from a distance of 15 to 20 feet away.
lead_paragraph: The North Charleston officer, who is white, had said Mr. Scott, an apparently unarmed black man, took his stun gun. But a video shows the officer firing at him eight times.

headline.main: South Carolina Officer Is Charged With Murder of Walter Scott
headline.print_headline: Officer Is Charged With Murder of a Black Man Shot in the Back
